document.docAuthor: Megna, Yoandri S., Balke, Michael, Apenborn, Rico & Hendrich, Lars
document.masterDocTitle: A review of Peruvian diving beetles of the genus Hydaticus Leach, 1817, with description of Hydaticus (Prodaticus) panguana sp. nov. and notes on other Neotropical species (Coleoptera: Dytiscidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of Peruvian diving beetles of the genus Hydaticus Leach, 1817, with description of Hydaticus (Prodaticus) panguana sp. nov. and notes on other Neotropical species (Coleoptera: Dytiscidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
VENEZUELA
: “ Venezuela , Caripito , 4.V. &
9.VIII.1942
, New York Zoo. Soc. Dept. Tropical Research”, 2 exs. , ( CGW , AMNH )
.
GUYANA
: “ Guyana , Bartica , New York Zoo. Soc. Dept. Tropical Research”, 1 ex. , ( AMNH )
.
SURINAME
: “ Surinam , Tafelberg Distr. , Saramacca Camp 2, 13 km NW of air strip,
20.VI.1979
, leg. M.S. Hoogmoed ”, 1 ex. , ( CGW )
.
PERU
: “ Peru , Huánuco Department , Yuyapichis , Stat. Panguana , 20.9.-
7.10.2013
, - 9.616667S , - 74.9333W , Bäche , Burmeister leg.”, 1 ex. , ( ZSM )
;
“ Peru / Amazonia Prov. Huánuco Río Yuyapichis , Panguana ,
VII.1982
Palmensumpf leg. E.G. Burmeister”, 1 ex. , ( ZSM )
;
“ Peru , Dept. Huánuco Panguana ACP, Río Yuyapichis ,
230m
, 9°37ʹS 74°56ʹW , 28.09.-
06.10.2000
, leg. E.G. Burmeister ”, 3 exs. , ( MUSM , ZSM )
;
“ Peru , Huánuco Department , Panguana , Yuyapichis river ,
25.vii.2013
, - 9.616667S , - 74.9333W , R. Apenborn leg.”, 7 exs. , ( MUSM , ZSM )
.

Diagnosis. TL = 12.9–13.8 mm ; TL-H = 12.2–13.1 mm ; MW = 6.8–7.2 mm ; pronotum black with lateral margins testaceous; elytron with basal fasciae not confluent with sublateral, longitudinal and yellowish stripes; elytron with sublateral stripes extended to the mid length of elytra, with a subtriangular, postmedial and broad spot ( Fig. 2B ); protarsomere I with a series of spines across the dorsal surface; metatibia with bifid setae curved ventro-basally on posterior surface; median lobe of aedeagus with apex rounded in lateral view ( Fig. 5 ).

Differential diagnosis.
Hydaticus lateralis
has the colour pattern of the pronotum and the elytra similar to
H. devexus
and
H. tuyuensis
, but can be distinguished from those species by the following combination of characters: elytron with transverse and subbasal yellowish fasciae, often with sublateral, longitudinal and yellowish stripe; elytron with basal and sublateral yellowish stripes not connected, and with a postmedial and broad spot.

Distribution. Prior to this study,
Hydaticus lateralis
had been recorded from Brazil and French Guiana only (Laporte 1835; Trémouilles 1996 ). Its range of distribution is now extended to Guyana , Venezuela , Suriname , and Peru ( Fig. 8 ).

Ecology. Trémouilles (1996) and Benetti & Hamada (2003) reported this species from lowland areas in Brazil . In Panguana,
H. lateralis
was collected in shaded and shallow rest pools of forest streams and temporary forest pools, packed with decaying leaves and wood ( Fig. 9A, 9B ).
Hydaticus lateralis
is sympatric and sometimes syntopic with
H. panguana
sp. nov.
and
H. subfasciatus
. The species is also attracted to light.
